title: Cnut the Great is crowned King of England.
text: Cnut the Great is crowned King of England.

title: Harold Godwinson (or Harold II) is crowned King of England.
text: Harold Godwinson (or Harold II) is crowned King of England.

title: Philip of Swabia becomes King of the Romans.
text: Philip of Swabia becomes King of the Romans.

title: Stephen Uroš III is crowned King of Serbia having defeated his half-brother Stefan Konstantin in battle.
text: Stephen Uroš III is crowned King of Serbia having defeated his half-brother Stefan Konstantin in battle.

title: Charles I of Bohemia is crowned with the Iron Crown of Lombardy as King of Italy in Milan.
text: Charles I of Bohemia is crowned with the Iron Crown of Lombardy as King of Italy in Milan.

title: Constantine XI is crowned Byzantine Emperor at Mystras.
text: Constantine XI is crowned Byzantine Emperor at Mystras.

title: The Catholic Monarchs Ferdinand and Isabella enter Granada, completing the Reconquista.
text: The Catholic Monarchs Ferdinand and Isabella enter Granada, completing the Reconquista.

title: King Henry VIII of England marries Anne of Cleves.
text: King Henry VIII of England marries Anne of Cleves.

title: The Union of Arras unites the southern Netherlands under the Duke of Parma, governor in the name of king Philip II of Spain.
text: The Union of Arras unites the southern Netherlands under the Duke of Parma, governor in the name of king Philip II of Spain.

title: English Restoration: The Fifth Monarchists unsuccessfully attempt to seize control of London, England.
text: English Restoration: The Fifth Monarchists unsuccessfully attempt to seize control of London, England.

title: Joseph, son of Emperor Leopold I, becomes King of the Romans.
text: Joseph, son of Emperor Leopold I, becomes King of the Romans.

title: The Committee of Inquiry on the South Sea Bubble publishes its findings.
text: The Committee of Inquiry on the South Sea Bubble publishes its findings.

title: In the Battle of Jersey, the British defeat the last attempt by France to invade Jersey in the Channel Islands.
text: In the Battle of Jersey, the British defeat the last attempt by France to invade Jersey in the Channel Islands.

title: Combined British, Portuguese and colonial Brazilian forces begin the Invasion of Cayenne during the Napoleonic Wars.
text: Combined British, Portuguese and colonial Brazilian forces begin the Invasion of Cayenne during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: Alfred Vail demonstrates a telegraph system using dots and dashes (this is the forerunner of Morse code).
text: Alfred Vail demonstrates a telegraph system using dots and dashes (this is the forerunner of Morse code).

title: The Night of the Big Wind, the most damaging storm in 300 years, sweeps across Ireland, damaging or destroying more than 20% of the houses in Dublin.
text: The Night of the Big Wind, the most damaging storm in 300 years, sweeps across Ireland, damaging or destroying more than 20% of the houses in Dublin.

title: The inauguration of the Musikverein in Vienna, Austria.
text: The inauguration of the Musikverein in Vienna, Austria.

title: The Washington National Cathedral is chartered by Congress. The charter is signed by President Benjamin Harrison.
text: The Washington National Cathedral is chartered by Congress. The charter is signed by President Benjamin Harrison.

title: Second Boer War: Having already besieged the fortress at Ladysmith, Boer forces attack it, but are driven back by British defenders.
text: Second Boer War: Having already besieged the fortress at Ladysmith, Boer forces attack it, but are driven back by British defenders.

title: Maria Montessori opens her first school and daycare center for working class children in Rome, Italy.
text: Maria Montessori opens her first school and daycare center for working class children in Rome, Italy.

title: New Mexico is admitted to the Union as the 47th U.S. state.
text: New Mexico is admitted to the Union as the 47th U.S. state.

title: German geophysicist Alfred Wegener first presents his theory of continental drift.
text: German geophysicist Alfred Wegener first presents his theory of continental drift.

title: King Alexander of the Serbs, Croats and Slovenes suspends his country's constitution (the January 6th Dictatorship).
text: King Alexander of the Serbs, Croats and Slovenes suspends his country's constitution (the January 6th Dictatorship).

title: Mother Teresa arrives in Calcutta, India, to begin her work among India's poorest and sick people.
text: Mother Teresa arrives in Calcutta, India, to begin her work among India's poorest and sick people.

title: The first diesel-powered automobile trip is completed, from Indianapolis, Indiana, to New York, New York.
text: The first diesel-powered automobile trip is completed, from Indianapolis, Indiana, to New York, New York.

title: Thomas Edison signs his last patent application.
text: Thomas Edison signs his last patent application.

title: United States President Franklin D. Roosevelt delivers his Four Freedoms speech in the State of the Union address.
text: United States President Franklin D. Roosevelt delivers his Four Freedoms speech in the State of the Union address.

title: The first general election ever in Vietnam is held.
text: The first general election ever in Vietnam is held.

title: Pan American Airlines becomes the first commercial airline to offer a round-the-world ticket.
text: Pan American Airlines becomes the first commercial airline to offer a round-the-world ticket.

title: The United Kingdom recognizes the People's Republic of China. The Republic of China severs diplomatic relations with the UK in response.
text: The United Kingdom recognizes the People's Republic of China. The Republic of China severs diplomatic relations with the UK in response.

title: Korean War: An estimated 200–1,300 South Korean communist sympathizers are slaughtered in what becomes the Ganghwa massacre.
text: Korean War: An estimated 200–1,300 South Korean communist sympathizers are slaughtered in what becomes the Ganghwa massacre.

title: National Airlines Flight 2511 is destroyed in mid-air by a bomb, while en route from New York City to Miami.
text: National Airlines Flight 2511 is destroyed in mid-air by a bomb, while en route from New York City to Miami.

title: The Associations Law comes into force in Iraq, allowing registration of political parties.
text: The Associations Law comes into force in Iraq, allowing registration of political parties.

title: Vietnam War: United States Marine Corps and ARVN troops launch "Operation Deckhouse Five" in the Mekong River delta.
text: Vietnam War: United States Marine Corps and ARVN troops launch "Operation Deckhouse Five" in the Mekong River delta.

title: In response to the 1973 oil crisis, daylight saving time commences nearly four months early in the United States.
text: In response to the 1973 oil crisis, daylight saving time commences nearly four months early in the United States.

title: The Crown of St. Stephen (also known as the Holy Crown of Hungary) is returned to Hungary from the United States, where it was held after World War II.
text: The Crown of St. Stephen (also known as the Holy Crown of Hungary) is returned to Hungary from the United States, where it was held after World War II.

title: Satwant Singh and Kehar Singh are sentenced to death for conspiracy in the assassination of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi; the two men are executed the same day.
text: Satwant Singh and Kehar Singh are sentenced to death for conspiracy in the assassination of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi; the two men are executed the same day.

title: President of Georgia Zviad Gamsakhurdia flees the country as a result of the military coup.
text: President of Georgia Zviad Gamsakhurdia flees the country as a result of the military coup.

title: Indian Border Security Force units kill 55 Kashmiri civilians in Sopore, Jammu and Kashmir, in revenge after militants ambushed a BSF patrol.
text: Indian Border Security Force units kill 55 Kashmiri civilians in Sopore, Jammu and Kashmir, in revenge after militants ambushed a BSF patrol.

title: A chemical fire in an apartment complex in Manila, Philippines, leads to the discovery of plans for Project Bojinka, a mass-terrorist attack.
text: A chemical fire in an apartment complex in Manila, Philippines, leads to the discovery of plans for Project Bojinka, a mass-terrorist attack.

title: The US Congress certifies George W. Bush winner of 2000 presidential election.
text: The US Congress certifies George W. Bush winner of 2000 presidential election.

title: American Civil Rights Movement: Edgar Ray Killen is arrested as a suspect in the 1964 murders of Chaney, Goodman, and Schwerner.
text: American Civil Rights Movement: Edgar Ray Killen is arrested as a suspect in the 1964 murders of Chaney, Goodman, and Schwerner.

title: A train collision in Graniteville, South Carolina, releases about 60 tons of chlorine gas.
text: A train collision in Graniteville, South Carolina, releases about 60 tons of chlorine gas.

title: Twenty-six people are killed and 63 wounded when a suicide bomber blows himself up at a police station in Damascus.
text: Twenty-six people are killed and 63 wounded when a suicide bomber blows himself up at a police station in Damascus.

title: Five people are killed and six others injured in a mass shooting at Fort Lauderdale–Hollywood International Airport in Broward County, Florida.
text: Five people are killed and six others injured in a mass shooting at Fort Lauderdale–Hollywood International Airport in Broward County, Florida.

title: The US Congress certifies Donald Trump winner of 2016 presidential election.
text: The US Congress certifies Donald Trump winner of 2016 presidential election.
